newsitem.title: CHINA: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly down.
newsitem.headline: China interbank market rates (CHIBOR) mostly down.

text.p: Followin1g is the China Interbank Offered Rate (CHIBOR) for Thursday issued by the official Xinhua news agency on behalf of the People's Bank of China, the central bank.
The figures represent weighted averages and not closing prices and are annual percentage rates.
Turnover fell sharply to 1.629 billion yuan from 3.007 billion yuan on Wednesday with the 60-day contract the most actively traded.
Traders said state-run banks and some short-term financial centres, money brokerages run by the central bank, were reluctant to do bussiness today.
Trading was comparatively slow with fund demand decreasing after the A shares tumbled this afternoon, they said.
Shanghai's A shares index plunged 6.07 percent to end at 1,467.861 points and the Shenzhen index fell 5.97 percent to 501.92 points on Thursday due to investor fears of a possible clampdown.
But the huge volume of the new issue from Gezhouba Co Ltd on the Shanghai Stock Exchange was a favorable factor for early-maturing contracts, traders said.
They said the rates would remain around current levels in the absense of market-moving news.
